content.description: A researcher studying a specific type of tree creates a least-squares regression line for relating the height and the diameter, both in meters, of a fully grown tree. The results are shown in the following computer output.
content.question: Variable <math alttext="D F " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="bold"><mrow><mtext mathvariant="bold">DF</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> Estimate <math alttext="S E " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="bold"><mrow><mtext mathvariant="bold">SE</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> T Intercept 1 5 4.00 2.50 Diameter 1 30 2.50 13.20 Which of the following values represents the predicted change in the height of the tree for each one-meter increase in the diameter of the tree?

skill.text: Skill 4.B: Interpret statistical calculations and findings to assign meaning or assess a claim.
